Comment: He opens with the standard e4, the most noble of openings!
I prefer the Caro-Kann to the sicilian or the standard e5 reply. It usually yields a better pawn structure in the end game as well as solid play on the queen side.
I usually see d4 or a Knight move so this was a bit surprising to me, though i'm sure it is a very normal move.
so i'm just going to carry on with the Kann.
all standard so far.
develops the bishop. Standard Caro-Kann.

Probably a wasteful move but it keeps the g5 square out of the Knights hands and gives my bishop a place to go in case of h4. I'm not big on bishop for knight trades and i wanted a solid pawn structure.

Probably a wasteful move but it keeps the g5 square out of the Knights hands and gives my bishop a place to go in case of h4. I'm not big on bishop for knight trades and i wanted a solid pawn structure.
adds more infrastructure to his e5 pawn.
Freeing up the dark squared bishop. Pretty standard caro-kann position.
So i'm trading my bad bishop for his good bishop, i can't really see it being a bad thing, even if my bishop was outside the pawns.
So i'm trading my bad bishop for his good bishop, i can't really see it being a bad thing, even if my bishop was outside the pawns.
attacking the closed center from the wing and giving the c6 spot back to my knight.
attacking the closed center from the wing and giving the c6 spot back to my knight.
further defending his center pawns.
adds pressure to the d4 orchid and develops. So far there really hasn't been any exciting play but it is still the opening.

tucking the king safely into the corner. White has a pretty fortified center and a safe king. Often times when play the Caro-Kann my king side stays undeveloped for a little while which probably isn't a good thing. However, i often have play on the queen side and when that opens up i am able to develop more.
Preparing to open the c file for my Rook.
This was a pretty solid move. He is looking to open up the center with my king still right in the thick of it.
But i'm going to carry on with my own plans of trying to control the c file.
With the advance of his f pawn, this capture now leaves the pawn at the e5 orchid unguarded.
So i snatch it, putting pressure on his lady.

I'm wondering if Nc6 would of been better. My king side is still undeveloped and that pawn is looking to break open the center, so my thought process was that a queen trade would really slow the game down and give me a little more freedom to develop.
